result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy R Fredrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
THIS COVERS 2015CF376, 2015CF422, 2015CF579, 2015CF583
03:41 PM Defendant Jeremy R Fredrickson in court by Zoom- audio;  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy R Fredrickson appeared by Zoom- audio means.
Probation agen Chris Waldron appeared by Zoom Video;  Community service agent S.H. present in the court room.

DA Wright relates the $10,346.85 restitution owing and communtiy service hours still remaining. State relates a Good faith effort has not been made. State moves to reduce the restitution to Judgment and 42 days of jail with huber and good time. Community service agent agreed to 61.5 hours of community service having been completed.  338 1/2 hours of community service hours are remaining.    3:48 Argument by Jeremy Fredrickson.  3:51 Probation agent relates; 3:56  More argument by Jeremy.
Court  finds and orders:
Defendant did Not make a good faith effort. 
Community service hours are coverted to jail. Defendant Must report  on 5-21-2020 by 4:00 PM and will sit until June 3, 2020 with huber for work.  Jail may allow electronic monitoring. 
Unpaid restitution is set to Judgment.  

SCAN to Jail.
Probation review hearing on May 20, 2020 at 03:45 pm.
Letter to Judge Bitney regarding multiple cases (4) and restitution/community service.
Unpaid

Defendant Jeremy R Fredrickson in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This covers 15CF376,15CF422,15CF579,15CF583 and 16CF143: 

16CF143: State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court orders this case be dismissed and read-in. No dispute regarding $100.00 buy money being added into other files. 
15CF583: Count 2 was previously dismissed and read-in on 3/14/16. However, counsel indicated he would plead guilty to count 2. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty of count 2 in this file. 

PSI discussed. Victim impact statements filed. 
S.N. provides statement.  J.F. provides statement. A.M. provides statement. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Sentencing - All probation terms concurrent. 
15CF376:
SW - 4 years probation 
15CF422:
SW - 4 years probation 
15CF579:
SW - 4 years probation 
15CF583:
Count 1 - SW - 3 years probation 
Count 2 - SW - 4 years probation 

Conditions of probation: 
$10,631.85 Restitution joint and several with any co-defendant's in 15CF579. C-31 filed. 
6 months jail with Huber for work - work search - domestic huber - treatment and good time - 87 days credit concurrent. Must report to jail on or before Friday, June 17, 2016.  
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
400 hours community service (100 hours per year on probation) 
Must remain absolute sobriety. 
Must not possess or consume intoxicants.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs including $100.00 buy money in 15CF579. 

Dismissed and read-in cases: Rusk County 15CF151, Chippewa County case 15CF473 , Eau Claire County case 15CM937 and uncharged counts in 15BA001774, 15BA001772, 15BA001418 & 15BA001319.
Felony admonitions given. 
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Sample to be submitted upon arrival in jail 6-17-16
Defendant's Alternative PSI.
